structure.unit: Real And Personal Property And Domestic Relations
Descent And Distribution, Wills, Estates Of Deceased Persons And Absentees, Guardianship, Conservatorship And Trusts

law.catch_line: Insufficient Funds; Payment Of Expenses Incurred In Anticipation Of Revenues To Be Received During Fiscal Year
law.text: [ Text of section effective until November 1, 2011. For text effective November 1, 2011, see below.] If during any session of the legislature there are insufficient funds in the Abandoned Property Fund to pay all the claims which have been allowed by the state treasurer or ordered to be paid by the court, the treasurer may incur expenses and the comptroller may certify for payment expenses incurred in anticipation of revenues to be received during the fiscal year. Chapter 200A: Insufficient funds; payment of expenses incurred in anticipation of revenues to be received during fiscal year [ Text of section as amended by 2011, 90, Sec. 12 effective November 1, 2011. For text effective until November 1, 2011, see above.] If during any session of the legislature there are insufficient funds in the Unclaimed Property Fund to pay all the claims which have been allowed by the state treasurer or ordered to be paid by the court, the treasurer may incur expenses and the comptroller may certify for payment expenses incurred in anticipation of revenues to be received during the fiscal year.
